text.0: the holy work i wrought before is wrought again my sweetest hymn is sung to celebrate your praise.
text.1: here o ye Ṛbhus is this sea for all the gods sate you with soma offered with the hallowing word.
text.2: when seeking your enjoyment onward from afar ye certain of my kinsmen wandered on your way.
text.3: sons of sudhanvan after your long journeying ye came unto the home of liberal savitar.
text.4: savitar therefore gave you immortality because ye came proclaiming him whom naught can hide.
text.5: and this the drinkingchalice of the asura which till that time was one ye made to be fourfold.
text.6: when they had served with zeal at sacrifice as priests they mortal as they were gained immortality.
text.7: the Ṛbhus children of sudhanvan bright as suns were in a years course made associate with prayers.
text.8: the Ṛbhus with a rod measured as twere a field the single sacrificial chalice wide of mouth.
text.9: lauded of all who saw praying for what is best desiring glorious fame among immortal gods.
text.10: as oil in ladles we through knowledge will present unto the heroes of the firmament our hymn.
text.11: the Ṛbhus who came near with this great fathers speed and rose to heavens high sphere to eat the strengthening food.
text.12: Ṛbhu to us is indra freshest in his might Ṛbhu with powers and wealth is giver of rich gifts.
text.13: gods through your favour may we on the happy day quell the attacks of those who pour no offerings forth.
text.14: out of a skin o Ṛbhus once ye formed a cow and brought the mother close unto her calf again.
text.15: sons of sudhanvan heroes with surpassing skill ye made your aged parents youthful as before.
text.16: help us with strength where spoil is won o indra joined with the Ṛbhus give us varied bounty.
text.17: this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
